title: Nervous system & brain health
subtitle: Evidence-based guidance for cognition, mood, sleep, stress resilience, and mental energy
disclaimer: Wellness guidance only; not diagnosis or treatment. Severe or sudden neurologic symptoms require medical care.

sections.title: The brain’s operating system
points: Hardware: neurons, synapses, myelin, blood vessels, mitochondria, immune cells.
Software: sleep-wake rhythms, stress circuits, learning/plasticity, neurotransmitter balance.
Most optimization is blood flow + sleep architecture + inflammation control + glucose stability + stress regulation.

sections.title: Nutrition patterns
points: Minimize ultra-processed foods to stabilize glucose

foundation.name: Omega-3 (EPA/DHA)
foundation.useCase: Low fish intake; mood/brain structural support
foundation.approach: Prefer fatty fish; supplement if intake is low

foundation.name: Magnesium
foundation.useCase: Sleep quality and stress edge, dietary shortfall
foundation.approach: Food first; glycinate/citrate often better tolerated

foundation.name: Choline
cautions: High doses can cause fishy odor/GI upset

conditional.name: B12 / Folate
cautions: Avoid masking B12 deficiency with folate alone

risks.title: Environmental and substance risks
items: Cannabis can reduce REM and affect drive
Sedentary time is a standalone risk

redFlags: Rapid cognitive decline or personality change

focus: Protein at breakfast + fiber at meals
Optional single supplement trial (magnesium, omega-3, or creatine)

protocols.title: 12-week resilience + cognition
steps: Increase aerobic volume toward WHO targets
Consider labs if symptoms persist (D, B12, thyroid, ferritin, HbA1c)
Structured exercise is a legitimate treatment tool for mood symptoms

checklist: Targeted supplements only for clear bottlenecks
personalizationQuestions: Average sleep hours and wake-time consistency
Main complaint (focus, anxiety, low mood, brain fog, sleep)
Diet pattern (fish intake, protein at breakfast)
